intro: Hieracium papillosum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by petal-like rays, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium papillosum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through rhizomes.
